name: Processing Principles
article_name: Principles relating to processing of personal data
description: Personal data shall be: (a) processed lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner (lawfulness, fairness and transparency); (b) collected for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes (purpose limitation); (c) adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary (data minimisation); (d) accurate and kept up to date; (e) kept in a form which permits identification for no longer than necessary (storage limitation); (f) processed in a manner that ensures appropriate security

name: Accountability Principle
article_name: Principles relating to processing of personal data
description: The controller shall be responsible for, and be able to demonstrate compliance with, paragraph 1 (accountability)

name: Six Legal Bases for Processing
description: Processing is lawful only if one of the following applies: (a) consent; (b) performance of a contract; (c) compliance with legal obligation; (d) protection of vital interests; (e) performance of a task in the public interest; (f) purposes of legitimate interests pursued by the controller

name: Processor Contract Requirements
description: Processing by a processor shall be governed by a contract or other legal act that sets out: subject-matter, duration, nature and purpose of processing, type of personal data, categories of data subjects, obligations and rights of the controller. Contract must stipulate processor shall: (a) process only on documented instructions; (b) ensure confidentiality; (c) implement security measures referred to in Article 32; (d) engage sub-processors only with authorization; (e) assist controller in responding to data subject requests; (f) assist with security, breach notification, and DPIA; (g) delete or return data after services; (h) make available information to demonstrate compliance

name: Security Measures
description: Taking into account state of the art, costs, nature/scope/context/purposes of processing, and risk to rights and freedoms, controller and processor shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures including: (a) pseudonymisation and encryption; (b) ability to ensure ongoing confidentiality, integrity, availability and resilience; (c) ability to restore availability and access in timely manner after incident; (d) process for regularly testing, assessing and evaluating effectiveness
